title: Clinical Deterioration Risk - Insufficient Data
factors: Only one set of vital signs available - unable to assess trends
No laboratory values to evaluate organ function
Minimal clinical documentation of patient status
Unknown baseline condition and acute changes
explanation: Cannot adequately assess clinical deterioration risk due to incomplete data. Clinical deterioration assessment requires: Serial vital signs (minimum every 4-6 hours) to identify trends, complete metabolic panel and CBC to assess organ function, arterial blood gas if respiratory concerns, detailed progress notes documenting clinical status and response to treatment, baseline functional and mental status, and any concerning symptoms or examination findings. Current single vital sign set appears stable but is insufficient for risk stratification. Recommend establishing monitoring frequency and completing diagnostic workup immediately.
